item.title: Everyone Wants High-Quality Clothes. That’s Become Its Own Trend.
item.description: Being a smart consumer has never been easier. Influencers and the fashion industry are all taking advantage of that.
item.dc:creator: Isabel Cristo

item.title: Australia’s Social Media Ban for Under-16s Is Coming. The Teenagers Are Skeptical.
item.description: The country is trying to wean children under 16 off the likes of TikTok, Snapchat, YouTube and Instagram with a new law. The teenagers are skeptical.
item.dc:creator: Victoria Kim and Matthew Abbott

media:content.media:credit: Matthew Abbott for The New York Times

item.title: Quote of the Day: Reche Canyon’s Plentiful, Calamitous, and Beloved, Burros
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, December 7, 2025.

item.title: Hong Kong Holds Vote as Officials Move Against ‘Anti-China’ Elements
item.description: The government is pushing hard to raise turnout in an election overshadowed by a deadly fire and public anger over safety lapses and official accountability.
item.dc:creator: David Pierson

media:content.media:credit: Lam Yik Fei for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The burned Wang Fuk Court apartment complex in Hong Kong, last month.

item.title: How Australia’s Social Media Ban for Children Will Work
item.description: The country is barring children under 16 from social media, with a sweeping federal law that is one of the first attempts at a nationwide regulation.
item.dc:creator: Victoria Kim

media:content.media:credit: Matthew Abbott for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: James Tomlinson, 9, playing a game on a phone in Melbourne, Australia.

item.title: Cynthia Erivo on Her Favorite Books, “Wicked” and Her New Memoir
item.description: “I have to be still for a certain amount of time,” says the “Wicked” star and author of “Simply More: A Book for Anyone Who Has Been Told They’re Too Much.”
item.category: Simply More: A Book for Anyone Who Has Been Told They're Too Much (Book)

media:content.media:credit: Rebecca Clarke

item.title: Corrections: Dec. 7, 2025
item.description: Corrections that appeared in print on Sunday, Dec. 7, 2025.

item.title: Fire in Goa, India, Kills at Least 25
item.description: Officials told the Indian news media that the fire tore through a nightclub in the southwestern state of Goa, a popular tourist destination.
item.dc:creator: Jin Yu Young

media:content.media:credit: Press Trust of India, via Associated Press
media:content.media:description: A deadly fire in Goa, India, left at least 25 people dead, officials said Sunday.

item.title: Judge Halts Justice Dept. Effort to Seek New Comey Indictment
item.description: The judge’s decision prevented the government until at least next Friday from having access to much of the evidence it used to secure its original indictment against Mr. Comey.
item.dc:creator: Alan Feuer

media:content.media:credit: Doug Mills/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A federal judge temporarily blocked the Justice Department from using evidence in its efforts to seek a new indictment against James B. Comey, the former F.B.I. director.

item.title: Hegseth Skirts Questions About Releasing Video of Sept. 2 Boat Attack
item.description: At an appearance in California, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth was noncommittal about releasing the full video of a U.S. military attack on a boat in the Caribbean.
item.dc:creator: Ashley Ahn
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Caylo Seals/Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth at the Reagan National Defense Forum in Simi Valley, Calif., on Saturday.

item.title: Francis Ford Coppola’s F.P. Journe Sells for $11 Million at Auction
item.description: Frenzied bidding pushed the polarizing F.P. Journe timepiece into near-record territory despite one dealer calling the design “goofy.”
item.dc:creator: Jacob Bernstein

item.title: In Honduras, Some Voters Were Swayed by Trump, Others Angered
item.description: President Trump backed Nasry Asfura days before the Nov. 30 election and denounced his opponents. In a close race, that has potentially tipped the scales.
item.dc:creator: James Wagner and Jeff Ernst

media:content.media:credit: Federico Rios for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Downtown Tegucigalpa, the Honduran capital, on Saturday.

item.title: Trump Administration Waives $11 Million Southwest Airlines Fine
item.description: The penalty was part of a fine imposed by the Biden administration after it determined the airline had failed to provide prompt customer service and refunds to passengers in 2022.
item.dc:creator: Adam Sella

media:content.media:credit: Taylor Glascock for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The $11 million penalty that the Trump administration said it would waive was part of a $140 million fine that the Biden administration imposed in 2023.

item.title: California Discourages Wild Mushroom Foraging After Fatal Outbreak
item.description: Officials said one person was killed and 20 others were poisoned after eating death cap mushrooms, which look and taste like safe mushrooms but can cause liver failure.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Ziegler

media:content.media:credit: California Department of Health, via Associated Press
media:content.media:description: California health officials advised people to stop foraging for wild mushrooms after a poison found in one variety killed one person and caused liver damage to others.

item.title: Potent Storm Expected to Drench Pacific Northwest and Bring Flooding
item.description: Fueling the storm will be a “very impressive” source of moisture from an atmospheric river, forecasters said. Flooding is forecast on more than a dozen rivers in Washington and Oregon.
item.dc:creator: Amy Graff

media:content.media:credit: Steve Ringman/The Seattle Times, via Associated Press

item.title: Original Thinkers
item.description: Kate Jensen’s debut Times puzzle comes with a cavalcade of luminaries.
item.dc:creator: Caitlin Lovinger

media:content.media:credit: Ryan Christopher Jones for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A couple in hooded onesies, cheering.

item.title: At Least 17 Migrants Die in Greece’s Worst Shipwreck in Two Years
item.description: Two people were rescued from a half-sunken boat off the island of Crete on Saturday evening, but 17 others died in the wreck.
item.dc:creator: Niki Kitsantonis
item.category: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis

media:content.media:credit: Costas Metaxakis/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Firefighters and members of the Hellenic coast responding after a migrant vessel sank off the island of Crete, on Saturday.

item.title: Map: 7.0-Magnitude Earthquake Shakes Alaska
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.
item.dc:creator: William B. Davis, Madison Dong, Judson Jones, John Keefe, Joey K. Lee and Bea Malsky

media:content.media:credit: The New York Times

item.title: Florida Man Charged in Murder of Woman Found Near Gilgo Beach
item.description: The woman’s body was found near her 2-year-old’s, and the man who was charged was the child’s father, the authorities said. The case did not appear to be linked to the Long Island serial killings.
item.dc:creator: Maia Coleman

media:content.media:credit: Philip Marcelo/Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Photos of Tanya Jackson and Tatiana Dykes were displayed in April by investigators. Their remains were found near Long Island’s Gilgo Beach.

item.title: María Corina Machado irá a Noruega a recibir el Premio Nobel de la Paz, según un funcionario
item.description: Las autoridades venezolanas afirman que Machado será considerada prófuga si va a Oslo, lo que pone al descubierto los riesgos que corre la líder de la oposición.
item.dc:creator: Simon Romero and Henrik Pryser Libell

media:content.media:credit: Adriana Loureiro Fernandez para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: María Corina Machado ha unido a una oposición a menudo fraccionada en los últimos años, pero las autoridades venezolanas le impidieron presentarse a las elecciones presidenciales.

item.title: Pita Limjaroenrat on the Future of Democracy
item.description: I was ousted from Thai politics. Here’s what that taught me about the state of democracy today.
item.dc:creator: Pita Limjaroenrat

media:content.media:credit: Adrià Fruitós

item.title: Guy Cogeval, Boundary-Pushing Museum Director, Dies at 70
item.description: His innovative approach drew crowds to the Musée d’Orsay, one of France’s flagship cultural institutions, which he led from 2008 to 2017.
item.dc:creator: Adam Nossiter

item.title: Could President Trump Bring Japan’s Tiny Cars to America? Not So Fast.
item.description: Mr. Trump is pushing to approve their production in the United States.
item.dc:creator: Hiroko Tabuchi

media:content.media:credit: Edgar Su/Reuters
media:content.media:description: A Japanese kei-car sits in a garage in Sapporo, Japan.

item.title: Pam Hogg, Iconoclastic Scottish Designer, Dies at 74
item.description: She was a star of London’s post-punk D.I.Y. fashion, art and performance scene, and dressed a generation of rock stars in her otherworldly handmade clothes.
item.dc:creator: Penelope Green

media:content.media:credit: Nick Knight/Trunk Archive
media:content.media:description: Pam Hogg in 2010. She was refused to be influenced by market forces or to alter her vision. “I’m giving them what they don’t know they want,” she told the BBC.

item.title: Crayola Magnetic Blocks Are Recalled Over Choking Hazard Concerns
item.description: Magnets in the toy, pip-Cubes, can fall out of the blocks and be swallowed by children, causing injury or death, federal regulators warned.
item.dc:creator: Rylee Kirk

media:content.media:credit: via Crayola
media:content.media:description: CreateOn, which imports the pip-Cubes toys, said that there have been reports of three cases of magnets falling out of the blocks.

item.title: Venezuela’s Nobel Winner Will Go to Norway for Peace Prize, Official Says
item.description: Venezuelan officials say María Corina Machado will be considered a fugitive if she goes to Oslo, laying bare the risks for the opposition leader.
item.dc:creator: Simon Romero and Henrik Pryser Libell

media:content.media:credit: Adriana Loureiro Fernandez for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: María Corina Machado has united an often fractious opposition in recent years, but the Venezuelan authorities blocked her from running for president.

item.title: Vietnamese Coffee Swirl Brownie Reicpe for Cookie Week
item.description: Have four words ever gone together so nicely? Leave it to Melissa Clark to give us the brownie we need, nay, deserve.
item.dc:creator: Vaughn Vreeland

media:content.media:credit: Rachel Vanni for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Samantha Seneviratne. Prop Stylist: Megan Hedgpeth.
media:content.media:description: Melissa Clark’s Vietnamese coffee swirl brownies.

item.title: Annalena Baerbock: Reflecting on the U.N.’s 80th Anniversary
item.description: In 2025, the United Nations turned 80. We asked the president of this year’s General Assembly to reflect on the organization’s work and the challenges it faces as it enters its ninth decade.
item.dc:creator: Annalena Baerbock
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

media:content.media:credit: Dave Sanders for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Secretary General António Guterres addressing a meeting of the United Nations Security Council in September during the annual gathering of the U.N. General Assembly in New York. The U.N. marked its 80th anniversary in 2025.

item.title: donkeys
item.description: donkeys

item.title: Donate This Holiday Season: Your Community Needs Your Help
item.description: Make yourself an active member of your community.
item.dc:creator: Jamelle Bouie

item.title: Atole de Grano Is Deeply Comforting
item.description: Frozen kernels, masa harina and hominy form the base of Rick Martínez’s warming atole de grano (savory corn porridge with chicken).
item.dc:creator: Mia Leimkuhler

media:content.media:credit: Julia Gartland for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Samantha Seneviratne.
media:content.media:description: Rick Martínez’s atole de grano.

item.title: Trump’s New Crackdown on Asylum Seekers
item.description: Hamed Aleaziz, our immigration reporter, describes the sweeping changes the Trump administration has made that affect asylum seekers — people fleeing harm in their home countries — since the shooting of two National Guard members in Washington.
item.dc:creator: Hamed Aleaziz, Alexandra Ostasiewicz, Leila Medina, Stephanie Swart, June Kim and Whitney Shefte

item.title: Cómo apoyar a quienes cuidan de otros
item.description: Si te preguntas cómo apoyar a un amigo que está cuidando de alguien, estos consejos prácticos de expertos y de quien ha pasado por eso te darán un punto de partida.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Passarella

item.title: Did You Follow the News Below the Fold? Take Our Year-End Quiz
item.description: These stories may not have made the front page — but they certainly left an impression.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Katzman

item.title: 12 People Killed in Mass Shooting at Illegal Tavern in South Africa
item.description: The police said they were searching for three assailants who opened fire, shooting 25 people. A 3-year-old boy was among the dead, while 13 survivors were being treated in the hospital.
item.dc:creator: John Eligon

media:content.media:credit: Alet Pretorius/Reuters
media:content.media:description: The scene of a mass shooting in Pretoria, South Africa, on Saturday.

item.title: Kidney Recipient Dies After Transplant From Organ Donor Who Had Rabies
item.description: Only four donors have transmitted rabies to organ transplant recipients since 1978, according to federal officials.
item.dc:creator: Rylee Kirk
item.category: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media:content.media:credit: Jeff J Mitchell/Getty Images
media:content.media:description: A man died of rabies he contracted after receiving a kidney transplant from another person who later tested positive for the virus after being scratched by a skunk.

item.title: Israel Backed Gazans to Oppose Hamas. For One, It Ended Violently.
item.description: Officials said Israel helped arm and back Yasser Abu Shabab’s Popular Forces, part of a strategy against Hamas, before a local clan killed him this week.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Boxerman

media:content.media:credit: Hatem Khaled/Reuters
media:content.media:description: A destroyed area of Rafah, Gaza. Yasser Abu Shabab and his militia group were based near the city.

item.title: Trump’s Security Doctrine Leaves Europe at a Strategic Crossroads
item.description: A new White House policy document formalizes President Trump’s long-held contempt for Europe’s leaders. It made clear that the continent now stands at a strategic crossroads.
item.dc:creator: Jason Horowitz

media:content.media:credit: Davide Monteleone for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A Norwegian soldier during a NATO military exercise this year. European governments have tried to wean themselves off American military might by increasing their own military spending and cooperation.

item.title: Scott Bessent on Tariffs, the Fed and the Economy
item.description: The U.S. treasury secretary spoke with Andrew Ross Sorkin at the DealBook Summit on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Kessler

media:content.media:credit: Karsten Moran for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Andrew interviews U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent at the 2025 DealBook Summit.

item.title: Why Is Christianity So Hard to Find in the Trump Administration?
item.description: Not too much religious moralism in the administration, but too little.
item.dc:creator: Ross Douthat
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Naila Ruechel for The New York Times

item.title: Netflix’s Swallowing of Warner Bros. Will Be the End of Hollywood
item.description: The demise of Hollywood has been predicted many times. If Netflix is allowed to acquire Warner Bros., it might actually happen.
item.dc:creator: Roy Price

media:content.media:credit: Illustration by Sam Whitney/The New York Times

item.title: The Supreme Court Is Failing at Its Most Important Job
item.description: Until the court imposes limits, the administration will keep acting as if there are none.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

media:content.media:credit: Illustration by Rebecca Chew/The New York Times

item.title: Pete Hegseth Is Ordering Executions at Sea
item.description: Did Pete Hegseth break the law after authorizing Venezuelan boat strikes? The Times Opinion editor, Kathleen Kingsbury, argues that there are multiple reasons the strikes were legally dubious.
item.dc:creator: Kathleen Kingsbury, Lauren Dominguez Chan and Stephanie Shen
item.category: US Strikes on Alleged Drug Traffickers (2025- )

item.title: Donate This Holiday Season: Hungry Kids Need Your Help
item.description: Share Our Strength takes on what both parties leave behind.

item.title: Have You Listened to a Good Book Lately?
item.description: Readers respond to a librarian who wrote that listening to a book qualifies as reading.

item.description: Will the president soon wish he hadn’t run for a second term?

item.title: China’s National Security Office in Hong Kong Summons Foreign Journalists
item.description: The authorities accused “some foreign media” of smearing the government’s response to a fire at a high-rise complex, saying: “Do not say you have not been warned.”
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

media:content.media:credit: Lam Yik Fei for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Smoke rising from the Wang Fuk Court residential complex in Hong Kong last month. Beijing’s national security arm in Hong Kong said that some foreign news outlets had twisted facts and spread false information.

item.title: Sweet Season
item.description: Rejoice: NYT Cooking’s holiday cookie extravaganza has returned.
item.dc:creator: Emily Weinstein

media:content.media:credit: Rachel Vanni for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Samantha Seneviratne. Prop Stylist: Megan Hedgpeth.

item.title: What Should I Do About the Bully in My Social Circle?
item.description: I know from experience that any vulnerability I expose will be used by this person.
item.dc:creator: Kwame Anthony Appiah
